# needsUpdateConstraints()

**Instance Method**

A Boolean value that determines whether the view’s constraints need updating.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func needsUpdateConstraints() -> Bool
```

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the view’s constraints need updating, [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] otherwise.

## Discussion

The constraint-based layout system uses the return value of this method to determine whether it needs to call [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView/updateConstraints()] on your view as part of its normal layout pass.

## Triggering Auto Layout

- **setNeedsUpdateConstraints()**: Controls whether the view’s constraints need updating.
- **updateConstraints()**: Updates constraints for the view.
- **updateConstraintsIfNeeded()**: Updates the constraints for the receiving view and its subviews.
